title: Christian Pulisic speaks out on his lack of goals at Chelsea
text:
Pulisic is yet to make his mark at Chelsea (Picture: Getty)

Christian Pulisic insists he is not worried about his failure to open his account for new club Chelsea despite making eight appearances without scoring.

Pulisic’s £58million move from Borussia Dortmund was announced back in January but he did not make the switch until the summer, making the wait for his first strike seem even longer.

But the American international played an important role in Chelsea’s only goal yesterday in the win over Newcastle United, beating several players before finding Callum Hudson-Odoi, who in turn set up scorer Marcus Alonso.

And the 21-year-old is not going to panic about his form just because he is yet to get on the score-sheet himself.

‘It was a really good game, happy for the team, had a strong performance, they defended really well, and I was happy to make an impact,’ Pulisic told ESPN after the match.

‘I was going to shoot last-second, but I saw Tammy wide open and then DeAndre [Yedlin, Pulisic’s US team-mate] made an unbelievable block, so maybe I should have shot it.

‘I just don’t have that scoring touch but I know it will come back.’

Pulisic has not been a prolific goal-scorer in his career so far with four his best-ever league tally in a single season.

Pulisic is a superstar for the US at international level (Picture: Getty)

He will be more interested in breaking into the starting XI more regularly, with half of six Premier League appearances so far coming as a substitute.

‘[Lampard] told me to do exactly what I’m doing now, continue to train hard, when I get my opportunity I have to take it,’ Pulisic added.

Pulisic will also know that Lampard will not shy away from giving the winger a chance on the basis of his tender years.

The Blues boss has made youth a central selection policy at Stamford Bridge with the likes of Fikayo Tomori, Mason Mount, Tammy Abraham and Hudson-Odoi all getting plenty of opportunities.

But the former midfielder does not seem like he will rush Pulisic into regular starts.

‘I am really pleased for him,’ Lampard said. ‘He is a hot topic because of his national team.

‘Everyone has got carried away with the short term but in the long term there is a lot more to come. I am delighted for him.

‘He will feel good about that and he should do.’
description: Christian Pulisic insists he is not worried about his failure to open his account for new club Chelsea despite making eight appearances without scoring.
